ruralFocus.title: Rural Health Focus
ruralFocus.description: Specifically designed to address the unique healthcare challenges faced by rural communities with limited access to medical facilities.

aiIntegration.title: AI Integration
aiIntegration.description: Advanced AI algorithms provide accurate symptom analysis and health recommendations based on user inputs and medical databases.

offlineAccess.title: Offline Access
offlineAccess.description: Core features work offline, ensuring healthcare guidance is available even in areas with poor internet connectivity.

mission.title: Making Healthcare Accessible
mission.description: Our mission is to democratize healthcare by providing reliable, AI-powered health assistance to rural communities, ensuring that quality healthcare guidance is just a tap away.

firstAid.title: First Aid Guide
firstAid.subtitle: Essential emergency procedures for common medical situations
firstAid.seekHelpTitle: When to Seek Emergency Medical Help:
firstAid.disclaimer: In case of life-threatening emergencies, call your local emergency services immediately. This guide is for educational purposes and should not replace professional medical training or emergency medical services.

burns.title: Burns
burns.description: Immediate care for thermal, chemical, or electrical burns

steps.step1: Remove the person from the source of the burn if safe to do so
steps.step1Warning: Do not touch electrical sources with bare hands
steps.step2: Cool the burn with cool (not cold) running water for 10-20 minutes
steps.step3: Remove any jewelry or tight clothing near the burned area before swelling occurs
steps.step4: Cover the burn with a sterile, non-adhesive bandage or clean cloth
steps.step5: Give over-the-counter pain medication if needed
steps.step5Warning: Do not apply ice, butter, or home remedies

seekHelp.largeBurns: Burns larger than 3 inches in diameter
seekHelp.faceHandsFeet: Burns on face, hands, feet, or genitals
seekHelp.thirdDegree: Third-degree burns (white, charred, or leathery appearance)
seekHelp.infection: Signs of infection (increased pain, redness, fever, swelling, or oozing)

cuts.title: Cuts & Wounds
cuts.description: Treatment for minor to moderate cuts and lacerations

steps.step1: Wash your hands thoroughly before treating the wound
steps.step2: Apply direct pressure with a clean cloth to stop bleeding
steps.step3: Clean the wound gently with clean water once bleeding stops
steps.step5: Cover with a sterile bandage and change daily
steps.step6: Keep the wound clean and dry while healing

seekHelp.deepCuts: Deep cuts that gape open or expose fat, muscle, or bone
seekHelp.bleeding: Bleeding that won't stop after 10 minutes of direct pressure
seekHelp.dirtyObjects: Cuts from dirty or rusty objects
seekHelp.tetanus: If tetanus vaccination is not up to date

steps.step1: Ask "Are you choking?" If they can speak or cough, encourage continued coughing
steps.step2: If unable to speak or cough, stand behind them and wrap arms around waist
steps.step3: Make a fist with one hand, place thumb side against upper abdomen, below ribcage
steps.step4: Grasp fist with other hand and give quick upward thrusts (Heimlich maneuver)
steps.step5: Continue until object is expelled or person becomes unconscious
steps.step5Warning: If person becomes unconscious, begin CPR

seekHelp.callEmergency: Call emergency services immediately for severe choking
seekHelp.persistent: If choking persists despite attempts to clear airway
seekHelp.afterRemoval: After successful removal if there are concerns about injury
seekHelp.infants: For infants under 1 year (different technique required)

fainting.title: Fainting
fainting.description: Care for someone who has fainted or feels faint

steps.step1: If person feels faint, help them sit down and put head between knees
steps.step2: If already fainted, check for responsiveness and breathing
steps.step3: Position person on their back and elevate legs 8-12 inches
steps.step4: Loosen tight clothing around neck and waist
steps.step6: When conscious, keep lying down for several minutes before sitting up slowly

seekHelp.noConsciousness: Person doesn't regain consciousness within 1 minute
seekHelp.duringExercise: Fainting occurs during exercise or physical activity
seekHelp.chestPain: Person has chest pain, difficulty breathing, or irregular heartbeat
seekHelp.injury: Signs of serious injury from falling
seekHelp.medicalConditions: Person has diabetes, heart disease, or other serious medical conditions

voiceAssistant.title: Voice Assistant
voiceAssistant.useTextInput: Your browser doesn't support voice recognition. You can still use text input to interact with the assistant.
voiceAssistant.microphonePermissionDenied: Microphone permission denied. Please enable microphone access to use voice commands.
voiceAssistant.feverAdvice: For fever, stay hydrated, rest, and consider taking paracetamol. Consult a doctor if fever persists or is very high.
voiceAssistant.headacheAdvice: For headaches, try resting in a quiet, dark room, stay hydrated, and consider over-the-counter pain relief. Seek medical help if severe.
voiceAssistant.emergencyAdvice: In case of emergency, call 108 for ambulance, 100 for police, or 101 for fire services. Stay calm and provide clear information.
voiceAssistant.defaultResponse: I'm here to help you navigate the health assistant. You can ask me to open different sections or ask basic health questions.
voiceAssistant.processingError: Sorry, I couldn't process that command. Please try again or use the navigation menu.

findHelp.noServicesFound: No services found matching your criteria

symptomChecker.title: AI Symptom Checker
symptomChecker.subtitle: Describe your symptoms and get AI-powered health insights
symptomChecker.clickToAdd: Click on symptoms to add them to your description
symptomChecker.enterSymptomsLabel: Enter your symptoms (e.g., "fever, headache, body ache")

analysis.consultImmediately: Please consult a healthcare professional or visit the nearest clinic immediately.
analysis.disclaimerText: This analysis is for informational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice. Always consult with a qualified healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment.

recommendations.stayHydrated: Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of fluids
recommendations.takeParacetamol: Take paracetamol for fever and headache relief
recommendations.avoidContact: Avoid contact with others to prevent spread
recommendations.callEmergency: Call emergency services if symptoms worsen
recommendations.drinkWarmLiquids: Drink warm liquids like tea with honey
recommendations.eatBlandFoods: Eat bland foods like rice, bananas, toast
recommendations.sipWater: Stay hydrated with small sips of water
recommendations.avoidSpicyFoods: Avoid spicy, fatty, or dairy foods
recommendations.stayHydratedRest: Stay hydrated and get adequate rest
recommendations.consultProvider: Consider consulting a healthcare provider if symptoms persist
recommendations.keepDiary: Keep a symptom diary for tracking
